name: maxindex
description:
This is a sub-function API for tool twelve_data.
Tool description: Financial data provided for developers, to enter the world markets. Instant access for real-time and historical data of stocks, forex, crypto, ETFs, indices, and more. Read more in [documentation](https://twelvedata.com/docs) and start [here](https://twelvedata.com/apikey).
API description: Fetches the index of the highest value over a specified period (MAXINDEX) using the Twelve Data API.

interval.description: Interval between two consecutive points in the time series. Supported values: `1min`, `5min`, `15min`, `30min`, `45min`, `1h`, `2h`, `4h`, `1day`, `1week`, `1month`.

symbol.description: Instrument symbol, which can be any equity, index, ETF, forex, or cryptocurrency (e.g., `AAPL`, `EUR/USD`, `ETH/BTC`).

time_period.description: The number of data points to consider. Defaults to 9.

series_type.description: Type of series data to retrieve. Supported values: `open`, `high`, `low`, `close`. Defaults to 'close'.

outputsize.description: The amount of data to retrieve. Default is 30 if no date parameters are set, otherwise it is set to maximum.

format.description: The format to receive the data in. Supported values: `CSV`, `JSON`. Defaults to 'json'.
